backend.src.app.models.blacklisttoken_model module

class backend.src.app.models.blacklisttoken_model.BlacklistToken(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

The BlacklistToken data model class describes the data structure of a blacklist token in the database.

Variables:

  • id – Unique identifier for a token.

  • jti – Unique JWT identifier (jti) for the token.

  • adding_time – The time when the token was added to the blacklist.

adding_time
id
jti
query: t.ClassVar[Query]

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

backend.src.app.models.client_model module

class backend.src.app.models.client_model.Client(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

The Client data model class describes the data structure of a client in the database.

Variables:

  • id – Unique identifier for a client.

  • name – Name of the client.

  • surname – Surname of the client.

  • email – Unique email for the client.

  • phone – Unique phone number of the client.

  • passport_number – Unique passport number for the client.

  • address – Address of the client.

  • birth_date – Date of birth of the client.

  • registration_date – Date of registration for the client.

  • rentals – List of rentals that the client has made.

  • SORT_ATTRIBUTES – A list of attributes on which we can sort the clients.

  • QUERY_SORT_PARAMS – A dictionary defining the sort order based on certain key strings. Each key string corresponds to a certain sort order.

QUERY_SORT_PARAMS = {'Free': 'asc', 'Rented': 'desc', 'abc': 'asc', 'highest': 'desc', 'latest': 'desc', 'lowest': 'asc', 'oldest': 'asc', 'zyx': 'desc'}
SORT_ATTRIBUTES = ['id', 'name', 'surname', 'email', 'phone', 'passport_number', 'address', 'birth_date', 'registration_date']

birth_date

backend.src.app.models.employee_model module

class backend.src.app.models.employee_model.Employee(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

The Employee data model class describes the data structure of an employee in the database.

Variables:

  • id – Unique identifier for an employee.

  • name – Name of the employee.

  • surname – Surname of the employee.

  • email – Unique email for the employee.

  • password – Hashed password for the employee.

  • phone – Unique phone number of the employee.

  • salary – Salary of the employee.

  • position – Position of the employee, can be one of EMPLOYEE_POSITIONS.

  • rentals – List of rentals that the employee has conducted.

  • LATEST_RENTALS_COUNT – The number of the latest rentals to return.

  • EMPLOYEE_POSITIONS – A list of valid positions that an employee can have.

  • SORT_ATTRIBUTES – A list of attributes on which we can sort the employees.

  • QUERY_SORT_PARAMS – A dictionary defining the sort order based on certain key strings. Each key string corresponds to a certain sort order.

EMPLOYEE_POSITIONS = ['Manager', 'Assistant']
LATEST_RENTALS_COUNT = 3
QUERY_SORT_PARAMS = {'Free': 'asc', 'Rented': 'desc', 'abc': 'asc', 'highest': 'desc', 'latest': 'desc', 'lowest': 'asc', 'oldest': 'asc', 'zyx': 'desc'}
SORT_ATTRIBUTES = ['id', 'name', 'surname', 'email', 'phone', 'salary', 'position']

backend.src.app.models.equipment_model module

class backend.src.app.models.equipment_model.Equipment(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

The Equipment class represents equipment in the rental system.

Variables:

  • inventory_number – The unique inventory number of the equipment. Acts as the primary key.

  • category – The category of the equipment (e.g., “Ski”, “Snowboard”, etc.).

  • manufacturer – The manufacturer of the equipment.

  • model – The model of the equipment.

  • size – The size of the equipment.

  • status – The current status of the equipment (e.g., “Free”, “Rented”, “Damaged”).

  • price_per_hour – The rental price per hour for the equipment.

  • description – A text description of the equipment.

  • registration_date – The date when the equipment was added to the system.

  • current_rental_id – The ID of the current rental if the equipment is rented, otherwise None.

  • EQUIPMENT_CATEGORIES – A list of valid categories that an equipment can belong to.

  • EQUIPMENT_STATUSES – A list of valid statuses that an equipment can have.

  • SORT_ATTRIBUTES – A list of attributes on which we can sort the equipments.

  • QUERY_SORT_PARAMS – A dictionary defining the sort order based on certain key strings. Each key string corresponds to a certain sort order.

EQUIPMENT_CATEGORIES = ['Ski', 'Snowboard', 'Ski boots', 'Snowboard boots', 'Helmet', 'Ski poles', 'Ski suit']
EQUIPMENT_STATUSES = ['Free', 'Rented', 'Damaged']
QUERY_SORT_PARAMS = {'Free': 'asc', 'Rented': 'desc', 'abc': 'asc', 'highest': 'desc', 'latest': 'desc', 'lowest': 'asc', 'oldest': 'asc', 'zyx': 'desc'}
SORT_ATTRIBUTES = ['inventory_number', 'category', 'manufacturer', 'model', 'size', 'price_per_hour', 'registration_date', 'current_rental_id']
category
current_rental_id

backend.src.app.models.rental_model module

class backend.src.app.models.rental_model.Rental(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

The Rental data model class describes the data structure of a rental in the database.

Variables:

  • id – Unique identifier for a rental.

  • date_start – Start date of the rental.

  • date_end – End date of the rental.

  • payment_type – Type of payment for the rental. Possible types are “Cash”, “Card”, “Bank transfer”.

  • base_price – Base price for the rental.

  • is_closed – Indicates whether the rental is closed.

  • damage_fee – Damage fee associated with the rental.

  • late_return_fee – Late return fee associated with the rental.

  • description – Description of the rental.

  • employee_id – The id of the employee who handled the rental.

  • client_id – The id of the client who made the rental.

  • equipments – List of equipment that were rented.

  • RENTAL_PAYMENT_TYPES – A list of possible payment types for the rental.

  • SORT_ATTRIBUTES – A list of attributes on which we can sort the rentals.

  • QUERY_SORT_PARAMS – A dictionary defining the sort order based on certain key strings. Each key string corresponds to a certain sort order.

QUERY_SORT_PARAMS = {'Free': 'asc', 'Rented': 'desc', 'abc': 'asc', 'highest': 'desc', 'latest': 'desc', 'lowest': 'asc', 'oldest': 'asc', 'zyx': 'desc'}
RENTAL_PAYMENT_TYPES = ['Cash', 'Card', 'Bank transfer']
SORT_ATTRIBUTES = ['id', 'date_start', 'date_end', 'payment_type', 'base_price', 'is_closed', 'damage_fee', 'late_return_fee', 'description']
